<a href="./index.html">Home</a> > <a href="./browser-logs.html">@datadog/browser-logs</a> > <a href="./browser-logs.logger.html">Logger</a>

## Logger interface

Set of convenience methods for each supported log level.

All methods accept the same parameters: `message`: human-readable log text. `messageContext`: optional JSON-serialisable object merged with the log context. `error`: optional `Error` instance captured with the log.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export interface Logger 
```

## Methods

<table><thead><tr><th>

Method


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

<a href="./browser-logs.logger.alert.html">alert(message, messageContext, error)</a>


</td><td>

Add an ALERT log (action must be taken immediately).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

<a href="./browser-logs.logger.critical.html">critical(message, messageContext, error)</a>


</td><td>

Add a CRITICAL log (serious failure).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

<a href="./browser-logs.logger.debug.html">debug(message, messageContext, error)</a>


</td><td>

Add a DEBUG log (developer usage).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

<a href="./browser-logs.logger.emerg.html">emerg(message, messageContext, error)</a>


</td><td>

Add an EMERGENCY log (system is unusable).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

<a href="./browser-logs.logger.error.html">error(message, messageContext, error)</a>


</td><td>

Add an ERROR log (runtime error).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

<a href="./browser-logs.logger.info.html">info(message, messageContext, error)</a>


</td><td>

Add an INFO log (notable but expected).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

<a href="./browser-logs.logger.notice.html">notice(message, messageContext, error)</a>


</td><td>

Add a NOTICE log (normal but significant).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

<a href="./browser-logs.logger.ok.html">ok(message, messageContext, error)</a>


</td><td>

Add an OK log (success).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

<a href="./browser-logs.logger.warn.html">warn(message, messageContext, error)</a>


</td><td>

Add a WARN log (unexpected behaviour).


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
